revised_title: Optical Time-Switching Systems for Wideband Local Networks
tldr: This article discusses various optical time-switching systems for wideband local networks, focusing on time-division multiple access (TDMA) and spectral-division multiple access (SDMA) techniques. The author reviews different implementations of TDMA, such as bit-multiplexing, block-multiplexing, and code-division multiplexing, and explores the potential of SDMA, including wavelength-division multiple access (WDMA) and frequency-division multiple access (FDMA). The article also highlights the challenges of synchronizing incoming data and the need for efficient switching systems in optical networks.
